japanese: ひええ……。
translation: Wowww...

japanese: なんつー場所だ……。
translation: What a place this is...

japanese:
（ロビーの洒落た造りといい、プールや
　フィットネスセンター完備という謳い文句といい
　観光地にアクセスしやすい好立地ぶりといい――）
translation:
(With the fancy lobby, pool and fitness center, 
 and a convenient location with easy 
 access to sightseeing spots%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（これが高級リゾートホテルってやつか……。
　まさか足を踏み入れる機会があるとはな）
translation:
(This really is what they call a luxury resort hotel...
 I never imagined I'd actually have a chance to 
 step inside one.)

japanese:
お、お兄ちゃんこれ見て！
このホテル、レストランがたくさんある！
translation:
H-hey, big bro, look at this! 
This hotel has so many restaurants!

japanese:
マジだ。
飯を食うところなんて１つあれば充分だろ？
translation:
For real.
But isn't one place to eat at enough?

japanese:
え？
和食や洋食で分かれるものじゃないかな。
translation:
Huh?
I think they're divided
into Japanese and Western cuisine.

japanese: お、おう……そうなるのか……。
translation: O-oh... I see...

japanese:
ここのホテル、スイーツの評判もいいんですよ。
特にケーキが美味しいらしいです。
translation:
This hotel has a good reputation for desserts too,
especially the cake.

japanese:
あと、上の階のラウンジは夜景が素敵なんですって。
夜になったら見に行ってもいいかもね。
translation:
Also, the lounge on the top floor
has a great night view.
We should go check it out at night.

japanese: ホテルから夜景……！
translation: A view of the city from the hotel...!

japanese:
大人の世界だ！
カクテルグラスを傾けるんだね！
translation:
That's so grown-up!
We'll have to tilt our cocktail glasses!

japanese:
そういうお店もありますよ。
もちろん、私たちはまだ飲んじゃダメですけど。
translation:
There are also places like that.
Of course, we can't drink yet.

japanese:
（いかん、俺の想像してたホテルと違いすぎる。
　１泊いくらかかるのか想像もつかねぇぞ……）
translation:
(Oh no, this is so different from the hotel I imagined.
 I have no idea how much one night costs...)

japanese:
上杉君？
顔色が悪いようですが、大丈夫ですか？
translation: Uesugi-kun? You look pale, are you okay?

japanese:
いや……。
なあ、本当にここに泊まっていいのか？
translation:
Well...
I mean, is it really okay for us to stay here?

japanese:
もちろんですよ。
予約もしてありますので心配しないでください。
translation: Of course it is. We have a reservation, so don't worry.

japanese:
そういうことじゃなくてだな？
ここ、一泊どのくらいかかるんだよ。
translation:
Wait, that's not what I meant.
How much does one night cost here?

japanese:
あ、あの、上杉君？
近くないですか……。
translation:
U-um, Uesugi-kun?
Aren't you a bit close...?

japanese: っと、悪い！
translation: Oh! Sorry!

japanese: なにやってるのよ。
translation: What are you doing?

japanese:
ぴぴー。
こういう場所での突発ラブラブはお控えくださーい。
translation:
Beep beeeep!
Please refrain from sudden
lovey-dovey moments in this kind of place.

japanese:
してねーよ！
してません！
translation:
We weren't doing anything!
Nothing at all!

japanese: 息ピッタリ。
translation: You're breathing in sync.

japanese:
あー、もう、からかうな！
それより――
translation:
Ahh, come on, stop teasing us!
More than that%p-2;――

japanese:
本当にここに泊まっていいのか？
一泊どのくらいかかるんだよ。
translation:
Is it really okay for us to stay here?
How much does one night cost?

japanese: 安いとは言えないかな。
translation: I wouldn't say it's cheap.

japanese: いつもよりはちょっと贅沢しちゃってますねー。
translation: We're splurging a little more than usuaaal.

japanese:
ちょっと……。
俺からすればとんでもない贅沢なんだが？
translation:
A little more...
From my perspective,
this is an OUTRAGEOUS indulgence, isn't it?

japanese: たまにはいいんじゃない。
translation: It's okay to splurge once in a while.

japanese:
そうですよ。
これは、父からあなたへの
感謝の気持ちでもあるようですから。
translation:
That's right.
This is also a token of appreciation
from Dad to you.

japanese: へ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
はっきりと聞いたわけではありませんが、
家庭教師の仕事をやり遂げたお礼という意味が
あるようです。
translation:
I didn't ask him directly,
but it seems to be a way of thanking you
for completing your job as a tutor.

japanese: そ、そうなのか。
translation: I-I see.

japanese:
つまり、上杉さんは
堂々と贅沢しちゃってオッケーなのです！
translation:
In other words,
it's okay for you to boldly indulge yourself,
Uesugi-san!

japanese:
（そういうことなら……
　変に萎縮しないで、目いっぱい
　楽しませてもらうのがよさそうだな）
translation:
(If that's the case...
 I shouldn't hold myself back and 
 actually enjoy myself to the fullest.)

japanese:
お待たせ。
チェックイン終わったよ。
translation:
Sorry to keep you waiting.
I've finished checking us in.

japanese:
で、部屋はツインが４つなんだけど、
どういう組み合わせにしよっか。
translation:
Right.
We have four rooms with twin beds,
but what kind of room arrangements should we go with?

japanese: 広さってどこも同じ？
translation: They're all the same size?

japanese: うん、間取りも設備も一緒だから不公平はないはず。
translation:
Yes, the size and layout are the same everywhere,
so it shouldn't be unfair
no matter what combination we choose.

japanese:
（２人部屋ってことは、
　ま、まさか、俺と五月が同部屋ってことも！？）
translation:
(So, we're getting rooms for two people.
 W-wait, does that mean
 Itsuki and I will be in the same room?!)

japanese:
（いや！　いやいや！　それはさすがにまずい！
　いくら付き合ってるとはいえ
　男女が同室など言語道断！！）
translation:
(No! No, no! That's definitely a no-go!
 No matter how long we've been dating, it's
 unthinkable for a man and a woman to share a room!!)

japanese:
あのぅ、上杉君？
部屋の希望は――
translation:
Um, Uesugi-kun?
About the rooms%p-2;――

japanese: おわぁっ！？
translation: OWAAH?!

japanese: え？　なんですか、その反応。
translation: Huh? What's with that reaction?

japanese:
あー？
さては……。
translation:
Ahhh?
Perhaps...

japanese:
ななな、なんでもない！
お、俺はらいはと同じ部屋で！
translation:
N-n-n-nothing!
I-I'll room with Raiha!

japanese:
そうですよねー。
それが自然ですよね。
むしろそれしかないって感じですね。
translation:
Yeah, that makes sense.
There's really no other option, right?

japanese:
おやおやぁ？
こっちもこっちで……。
translation:
Oh, oh?
You too, Itsuki...

japanese: な、なんですか？
translation: Wh-what is it?

japanese: 五月ちゃん、フータロー君と同室がいい？
translation:
Itsuki-chan,
do you want to be in the same room as Futaro-kun?

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: Huhhh?!

japanese: なっ――
translation: What the%p-2;――

japanese:
け、結構ですっ！
私は一花と同室で！
translation:
I-I'm alright!
I'll room with you, Ichika!

japanese:
はーい。
よろしくね。
translation:
Okaaay!
Looking forward to it then.

japanese:
他はどうしよう？
誰かが１人部屋になるけど。
translation:
What about the rest of us?
Someone will have to be in a single room.

japanese: じゃあ私がひとりでいいよ。
translation: Well, I can take the single room.

japanese:
あっ！
だったら私、お兄ちゃんとじゃなくて
四葉さんと一緒がいいな。
translation:
Ah! In that case,
I'd like to be in the same room as Yotsuba-san
instead of big bro.

japanese:
いいんですか、らいはちゃん！
では是非、一緒の部屋で！
translation:
Is that okay, Raiha-chan?
Alrighty, let's room together then!

japanese:
そんな……らいは……。
俺と同じ部屋は嫌なのか……。
translation:
What... Raiha...
You don't want to room with me...?

japanese:
ふっ……。
あの小さかったらいはも、
気がつけばもう思春期なんだな。
translation:
Heh...
Even little Raiha is growing up,
isn't she?

japanese: えーと、なに目線？
translation: Ermm, what are you looking at?

japanese:
そうじゃなくて。
ほら、お兄ちゃんは１人のほうがいいよね？
translation:
No, it's not like that.
Anyway, you'd like to be in a single room, right, big bro?

japanese: は？　なんでだ？
translation: Huh? Why's that?

japanese:
なんでって……。
ねー、五月さん！
translation:
Well, I mean...
Isn't that right, Itsuki-san?!

japanese:
え、ええ。
男性は上杉君１人ですし、
１人部屋というのは自然ですね。
translation:
Y-yes.
It's only natural for a man
to want privacy in his own room, isn't it?

japanese: それも違うんだけどなー。
translation: That's not exactly what I meant, though...

japanese: らいはちゃんのほうが大人だ。
translation: Raiha-chan is the more mature one.

japanese: というよりも、フー君と五月がお子様なのよ。
translation: ...Or rather, Fu-kun and Itsuki are like children.

japanese:
よくわからんが、俺は１人部屋でも問題ない。
らいはのことは任せた、四葉。
translation:
I don't really get it,
but I don't mind having a single room.
Raiha is all yours, Yotsuba.

japanese: はい、任されました！
translation: Alright! Leave her to me!

japanese: じゃ、私が三玖とね。
translation: Okay, I'll be with Miku, then.

japanese: いいよ、よろしく。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
部屋割りは決まりですね。
それではさっそく――
translation:
Right, room arrangements are settled then.
Now, let's%p-2;――

japanese: おう、部屋に――
translation: Yeah, head to our rooms%p-2;――

japanese: レストランで夕食にしましょう！
translation: Go to the restaurant for dinner!

japanese:
いや先に部屋だろ？
荷物どうすんだよ。
translation:
No, we'll go to our rooms first, right?
What about our luggage?

japanese:
それなら大丈夫だよ。
ベルパーソンが運んでくれるし。
translation:
Don't worry.
The bellhop will take care of it for us.

japanese:
（そういうもんなのか……。
　すげえな、舐めてたぜ高級ホテル……）
translation:
(So that's how it works...
 I honestly can't believe how amazing 
 these luxury hotels are...)

japanese: 言われてみれば、お腹空いてきた。
translation: Now that you mention it, I'm pretty hungry.

japanese: それじゃあ、行きましょー！
translation: Okay then, let's gooo!

japanese: はーい。
translation: Right-o!
